info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN PERQUIMANS... SOUTHEASTERN BERTIE AND SOUTHERN CHOWAN COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cape Colony, or 10 miles southwest of Hertford, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Perquimans, southeastern Bertie and southern Chowan Counties, including the following locations... Merry Hill, Light Nixon Fork, Edenhouse, Saint Johns, Macedonia, Hancock, Yeopim Station, and Somerset. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
